newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Hundreds fooled in Indonesian civil service scam.
newsitem.headline: Hundreds fooled in Indonesian civil service scam.

text.p: Almost 300 Indonesian would-be civil servants were fooled in a jobs scam, some tricked into paying a middleman more than $4,000 to help them get government jobs that did not exist, Kompas newspaper reported on Saturday.

The paper said 288 people, who had paid a middleman between four million and 10 million rupiah ($1,658 to $4,145) for a civil service job, arrived at the Jakarta office of the Transmigration Department on Thursday ready to be inducted.
Payments of bribes to obtain coveted civil service jobs are common in Indonesia, which suffers high unemployment.
The newspaper quoted the department's secretary general Hardoyo as saying letters summoning the candidates to the department were forged.
Police have detained 13 people suspected of involvement in the scam for questioning, the newspaper said.
